content:
Downtown is a great location! There are plenty of options within a 10-15 minute walk.

Salad Bars:

1. Dig Inn (5-minute walk): Known for their farm-to-table approach, Dig Inn offers a variety of seasonal vegetables and lean proteins. You can create your own salad or choose from their signature options.
2. Sweetgreen (7-minute walk): A popular salad chain with a focus on locally sourced ingredients. They offer a variety of signature salads, and you can customize your own with their online nutrition guide.
3. Chopt Creative Salad Co. (10-minute walk): Chopt offers a wide range of ingredients and allows you to create your own salad or choose from their seasonal options. They also have a nutrition guide to help you make informed choices.

Food Trucks:

1. The Salad Truck (varies): This truck offers a variety of creative salads, wraps, and bowls, with a focus on locally sourced ingredients. You can check their Twitter handle to see their daily location.
2. Freshii (varies): Freshii offers healthy, customizable bowls, wraps, and salads with a focus on lean proteins and vegetables. They often park near downtown, so keep an eye on their schedule.

Now, about meal prep!

Meal prep can be a game-changer for saving time and money. Here are some tips to get you started:

1. **Plan your meals**: Decide on 3-5 meals you want to prep for the week, considering your dietary preferences and ingredient availability.
2. **Make a grocery list**: Write down the ingredients you need for your meals and stick to your list when shopping. Buy in bulk and opt for seasonal produce to save money.
3. **Cook in bulk**: Prepare large batches of rice, quinoa, or grains, and roast vegetables like broccoli, sweet potatoes, or chicken breast. These can be used throughout the week in various meals.
4. **Portion control**: Divide your cooked meals into individual portions and store them in airtight containers. This will help you avoid overeating and save time during the week.
5. **Label and date containers**: Clearly label each container with the meal name, date, and any reheating instructions.
6. **Store and reheat**: Store your prepped meals in the fridge for up to 3-4 days or freeze for up to 2 months. Reheat as needed throughout the week.

Some popular meal prep ideas for beginners include:

* Grilled chicken or turkey breast with roasted vegetables
* Quinoa or brown rice bowls with lean proteins and mixed veggies
* Lentil or black bean salads with lean proteins and whole grain wraps
* Overnight oats with fruit and nuts

Remember, start small and experiment with different recipes to find what works best for you. Happy meal prepping!
